title: Trump Mideast Plan Arose From a Secretive, Shifting Two-Year Effort
summary: Israeli political turmoil posed delays, forced a change in course at the White House. WASHINGTON-In late December, President Trump's aides had a decision to make about his long-delayed Middle East peace plan. Israel was headed for an unprecedented third set of elections, leaving an interim government running the country-and no consensus leader to serve as Washington's partner on its peace plan.

title: Impeachment Winds Down With Whimper as Washington Moves On
summary: 'We all need a break. This is as close to purgatory as any of us want to get,' says senator. WASHINGTON-Sen. Bernie Sanders speed-walked out of the Capitol and phoned into a campaign rally in Iowa, apologizing for not being there in person. Sen. Lindsey Graham headed home to South Carolina, where a pulled-pork platter awaited him. And President Trump jetted down to Florida.

title: American Sofia Kenin Wins Australian Open, Her First Grand Slam Title
summary: The 21-year-old defeated Garbiñe Muguruza of Spain, 4-6, 6-2, 6-2. With the years of Serena Williams's dominance now in the rearview mirror, women's tennis is firmly in its unpredictability era.

title: Trump's GOP Challengers Try to Catch Voters' Attention
summary: Walsh, Weld make their cases in Iowa; 'You probably won't caucus for me. It's great to be here'. DES MOINES, Iowa-As Iowa's leadoff caucuses approach, Democratic presidential hopefuls are vying for the nomination and President Trump is showing off his campaign muscle.

title: Nike Track Coach Alberto Salazar Gets New Suspension
summary: Salazar previously got a four-year ban by the U.S. Anti-Doping Agency; he is appealing. Famed Nike track coach Alberto Salazar, already banned from the sport for doping violations, on Friday was temporarily suspended by the U.S. Center for SafeSport pending an investigation of allegations of misconduct, according to the center's centralized disciplinary database.

title: Colin Kaepernick's Glaring Absence at the Super Bowl
summary: The last 49ers quarterback to take the team on a run to the big game has been largely absent in the run-up to Super Bowl LIV; 'They're trying to erase him'. MIAMI-During the 49ers' run to this Super Bowl, there has been one glaring absence: Colin Kaepernick.

title: Avian Influenza in China Adds to Economic Concerns Amid Coronavirus
summary: China pledges more support for its economy, exempts from punitive tariffs products imported from the U.S. to control the outbreak. HONG KONG-Chinese authorities announced Saturday a recurrence of avian influenza in chickens in central China, adding fresh economic concerns for a country reeling from an outbreak of coronavirus that has sickened nearly 12,000 people since it emerged in December.

title: Apple Closes Chinese Stores, Corporate Offices Due to Coronavirus
summary: The company operates more than 40 stores in China and relies on the country for about a fifth of total sales. Apple Inc. said Saturday it will close its stores and corporate offices in China until Feb. 9, a significant escalation in its response to the coronavirus outbreak gripping China and roiling global markets.

title: Why Sofia Kenin May Be the Tom Brady of Tennis
summary: An early coach sees a bright future-and uncanny mental toughness-in the new Australian Open women's champion. Miami

title: Bloomberg Proposes Trillions in Tax Increases to Pay for His Agenda
summary: Billionaire Democratic presidential candidate proposes raising taxes on high-income individuals, estates, corporations and other businesses. WASHINGTON-Democratic presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg is proposing tax increases on corporations, top earners and estates that would make the wealthiest Americans foot the bill for programs in areas such as education, infrastructure and climate change.

title: Democrats Play Game of Expectations Ahead of Iowa Vote
summary: For lower-polling candidates, a surprisingly strong finish in the state's caucuses can fuel momentum heading into New Hampshire. DES MOINES, Iowa-In hotel bars, at campaign events and on television screens across this state, it is peak season for the expectations game.

title: Airbus Agrees to Monitoring in $4 Billion Settlement
summary: World's largest plane maker is alleged to have made illicit payments to middlemen around the world. Airbus SE agreed with the U.S. to have its global defense business monitored by an external compliance officer-part of a sweeping €3.6 billion ($4 billion) deal with American, U.K. and French prosecutors that settles alleged bribery and export-control violations against the plane maker.

title: New York Bars Put $100 Brews on Reserve Lists
summary: Proliferation of pricey brews is tied to ever-growing interest in craft beer. At Pretty Ricky's, a bar on Manhattan's Lower East Side that opened a few months ago, patrons have their pick of a range of craft beers, priced at as little as $4 for a 7-ounce pour. But if they are in a festive mood, they can spend more for a select group of hard-to-find brews on a "reserve" list.

title: Trump's Impeachment Is Virtually Over. What Did It Change?
summary: Resume Subscription. No experience as searing as a presidential impeachment trial-dramatic, emotional and seen only twice before in American history-can end without leaving lasting marks.

title: Iowa Caucuses to Be Testing Ground for New Efforts to Protect Voting From Hackers
summary: Precautions range from revamped electronic systems backed up by paper ballots to cybersecurity experts on standby. With Iowans kicking off voting in the 2020 presidential election season, the race is also on to protect the vote from cyberattacks and other intrusions.

title: Does Your Razor Need a Gender?
summary: More consumer goods makers are eliminating gender traits from their marketing as shoppers question their value. Do we need his and hers razors?

title: New Homelessness Czar Takes Aim at Longstanding Policy
summary: As the number of homeless rises, Robert Marbut pushes for tying services to housing vouchers, among other measures. The Trump administration's new homelessness czar is proposing a wholesale shift in the country's philosophy for aiding the unhoused, potentially upending existing approaches as big cities and states struggle with the deepening problem.

title: Lakers Honor Kobe Bryant With an Emotional Basketball Memorial
summary: 'Mamba out,' LeBron James said during a speech at mid-court before the game. 'But in the words of us, not forgotten. Live on, brother.'. When he came to Staples Center for a final time last month to watch a Los Angeles Lakers game, Kobe Bryant was in floor seats with his 13-year-old daughter, Gianna, and LeBron James and others made their way over and paid their respects to one of the greatest players in NBA history.

title: 'Manuel Álvarez Bravo: Specters and Parables' Review: Where the Gorgeous and Cryptic Meet
summary: Photographer Manuel Álvarez Bravo is best known for images of Mexican iconography, but an exhibition reveals him to be not just the chronicler of a nation, but a storyteller of mysteries..

title: Australia Restricts Travelers From Mainland China as Virus Impact Spreads
summary: Foreign nationals who have been in mainland China will be barred from entry, and citizens who have been there must self-quarantine. SYDNEY-Australia on Saturday barred foreign nationals who have been in mainland China from entering the country, and ordered its own returning citizens to self-quarantine for 14 days, as the impact of the new coronavirus on world-wide travel spreads.

title: In Virus-Hit China, Markets Brace for a Fall as Authorities Urge Calm
summary: China's markets have been closed since Jan. 23, but are scheduled to open Monday. Stocks in China are primed for a steep fall Monday when markets in Shanghai and Shenzhen reopen after a week-long closure, even as Chinese authorities try to calm frayed nerves over the fast-spreading Wuhan coronavirus.

title: As Market Booms, Wells Fargo Advisers Struggle
summary: Wealth-management profits barely budge after fake-account scandal. The booming stock market has meant brisk business for financial advisers. Not so at Wells Fargo & Co.

title: Employees Speak Out-Against Their CEOs
summary: A generation of workers attuned to activism is getting comfortable with challenging the top boss. Chief executives routinely face barbs from investors and the media. Now some are dealing with criticism from a group closer to home: their own staffs.

title: Roku and Fox Reach Distribution Deal to Avoid Streaming Blackout
summary: Standoff is latest dispute between channel owners and streaming-device manufacturers. Roku Inc. and Fox Corp. reached a distribution deal late Friday, narrowly avoiding a blackout that would have removed Fox apps from the Roku streaming platform ahead of the Super Bowl.

title: PG&E Promises Board Shake-Up as It Pursues California's Approval on Bankruptcy Exit
summary: Utility rounded up creditor support in bankruptcy, but still faces criticism from California's governor. PG&E Corp. pledged to shake up its board of directors and increase its safety focus in a bid to win California's support for its bankruptcy exit plan, but obstacles remain in appeasing Gov. Gavin Newsom.

title: Biden Started Year With Less Cash Than Other Top Hopefuls
summary: Warren, Sanders and Buttigieg burned through more money than they raised in fourth quarter, filings show. Former Vice President Joe Biden began the year with about $9 million in available campaign cash-less than the other three top-polling Democratic presidential candidates, reports filed Friday show.

title: Sanders, Trump Stand Strong
summary: Two trends create a sharper focus for the beginning phase of the primary season.

title: The Ultimate Animal-Themed Valentine's Day Gift Guide
summary: These presents for her-from Tiffany & Co.'s rhino necklace to Tory Burch's butterfly sweater-are sure to arouse fuzzy feelings. This candle's jungle-flora scent will transport her to the rainforest. Candle, $165, livecostabrazil.com

title: Rooting for the Midwest to Win Super Bowl Glory
summary: Modern football was born in America's heartland. That's why I'm hoping the Kansas City Chiefs triumph on Sunday.. The weather forecast for the AFC title game on Jan. 19 told me all I needed to know. The temperature on the field at Arrowhead Stadium in Kansas City, Mo., home to the Chiefs, was 18 degrees, but it felt more like 5. I watched from the comfort of my apartment on the east coast, where it was a balmy 42 degrees, but as a native of Chicago I remembered that Midwestern cold. Growing up, we only had two seasons, hot and cold. You knew things were ebbing towards cold as you counted down the days to opening day kickoff, which marked the welcome end of the dog days of summer and the dreaded opening salvo of winter, which would last from October to April.

title: From Surfer Secret to Jet-Set Getaway
summary: Siargao, a sublimely scenic Philippine island, is a worldly tropical haven trying not to grow too fast. CAN YOU BE homesick for a part of your country you've never known? In October, about a year after I moved from Manila, the Philippine capital, to New York City, I booked my first trip to Siargao (pronounced "shar-gow"), a small, pear-shaped island in southern Philippines. Glossy international magazines had just starting touting it as the "next Bali" and the "world's best island." Missing out on its sudden jet-set status felt almost unpatriotic.

title: Chief Justice Says He Wouldn't Break a Tie
summary: John Roberts rejects idea that actions in 1868 case could serve as precedent. Chief Justice John Roberts on Friday finally addressed a central mystery of President Trump's impeachment trial: Would he step in to break a 50-50 tie in a Senate vote?

title: Mary Higgins Clark, 'Queen of Suspense,' Dies at 92
summary: Author of bestselling thrillers such as 'A Stranger is Watching' died of natural causes in Florida. Mary Higgins Clark, the tireless and long-reigning "Queen of Suspense" whose tales of women beating the odds made her one of the world's most popular writers, died Friday at age 92.

title: Former Ukraine Ambassador Yovanovitch Retires
summary: Envoy had been a professor since she was recalled from Ukraine. Marie Yovanovitch, the former U.S. ambassador to Ukraine who was removed from her post in May 2019 and testified as part of the House impeachment inquiry, has retired from the State Department, according to a person familiar with her decision.

title: Protests of Policing in New York City Subway Lead to Arrests
summary: Demonstrations follow MTA's recent decision to hire an additional 500 officers. Several demonstrators protesting against police enforcement in the New York City subway system were arrested at transit hubs and on streets Friday night, officials said.

title: Gilead Sciences Offers Experimental Drug for Coronavirus Treatments, Testing
summary: The U.S. biotech firm has formalized agreement with China to conduct clinical trial of remdesivir. Gilead Sciences Inc. said on Friday that it had provided doses of an experimental antiviral drug to doctors for the emergency treatment of a small number of patients infected by the new coronavirus.

title: Senate Rejects Witnesses in Trump Impeachment Trial
summary: Republican majority, by a 51-49 vote, keeps new evidence from being introduced. WASHINGTON-Senate Republicans rejected Democrats' demands to call new witnesses and documents in President Trump's impeachment trial, clearing the way for an acquittal on abuse of power and obstruction-of-Congress charges next week.

title: How Republicans Scotched the Idea of Impeachment Witnesses
summary: White House, Senate GOP leaders swung into a good-cop, bad-cop routine to keep lawmakers in the fold after Bolton book leak. WASHINGTON-At the White House on Sunday evening, as the phones started ringing nonstop and emails flooded in, President Trump took aim at the cause of the alarm: John Bolton, his former national security adviser.

title: U.S. Imposes Entry Restrictions Over Coronavirus
summary: Foreign nationals who visited China in the past 14 days will be barred from entering, while Americans who visited province at center of outbreak will be quarantined. The U.S. imposed entry restrictions on foreign nationals and quarantines on Americans returning from the Chinese province at the center of the coronavirus outbreak, as markets tumbled over fears about the impact on global growth.

title: Elizabeth Warren's Gas Royalties
summary: She talks as if oil stains everything it touches. What about her family's Oklahoma gas rights?. On her first day as President, Elizabeth Warren says she will "ban fracking-everywhere," while putting a "total moratorium" on leases offshore and on federal lands. Ms. Warren has signed a pledge to refuse campaign contributions over $200 from the oil-and-gas industry. She's a past sponsor of a Senate bill called the Keep It in the Ground Act.

title: Why Hope Is Fading for Sprint and T-Mobile
summary: A lousy strategy by the Trump administration is leading to a court loss and a loss for consumers.. In a 1931 essay, Winston Churchill marveled and fretted over the accelerating pace of industrial and technological change, predicting the cellphone and much else. He also acknowledged that the only solution for the problems of progress was more progress: "Mankind has gone too far to go back. . . . There are too many people maintained, not merely in comfort but in existence, by processes unknown a century ago."

title: Wuhan Wilbur Ross
summary: The Commerce Secretary talks up the coronavirus as a U.S. jobs boon.. The Trump Administration declared a public health emergency Friday over the coronavirus outbreak, and stocks fell some 2% on fears of the economic fallout. So why is Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross talking about the contagion that began in Wuhan, China, as if it's a boon for America?
